thread.title: Grand Canyon expecting huge crowds of visitors over holiday weekend, urging use of shuttles
thread.title_full: Grand Canyon expecting huge crowds of visitors over holiday weekend, urging use of shuttles - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Associated Press
title: Grand Canyon expecting huge crowds of visitors over holiday weekend, urging use of shuttles
text:
GRAND CANYON NATIONAL PARK, Ariz. - Anyone planning a Grand Canyon trip this weekend could be waiting 30 minutes or longer to get in.
Park spokeswoman Emily Davis says the Grand Canyon has seen a 20 per cent increase in visitation through the first quarter of this year. If the trend holds, traffic will be backed up at entrance stations and parking lots will fill up fast.
July typically is one of the busiest months of the year at the Grand Canyon, with some 622,000 visitors last July. About 4.5 million people visit the canyon annually.
To cut down on vehicle traffic inside the park, Grand Canyon officials are urging South Rim visitors to use the shuttle service from Tusayan (TU'-say-ohn). Visitors then can use shuttle buses. However, those will be crowded too and require a wait.
